intro: Gagea bohemica var. velenovskyana, commonly known as the Bohemian spring beauty, is a rare and delicate member of the Liliaceae family. It is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and is native to specific regions in Central Europe. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
